section_heading: Significance Statement
evidence_span: The unfolded protein response (UPR) increases the protein folding capacity of the ER in response to stresses and through unknown means exerts control over plant growth and development.

section_heading: Significance Statement
evidence_span: Plastid stress promotes the buildup of MEcPP (2-C-Methyl-D-erythritol-2,4-cyclopyrophosphate), which through an unknown mechanism, activates CAMTA3 (Calmodulin biding transcriptional activator 3) inducing transcription of bZIP60.2.

section_heading: Significance Statement
evidence_span: S2P proteases cleave the active transcription factor from its transmembrane domain.bZIP28 enters the nucleus and acts redundantly with bZIP60 to transcriptionally activate the UPR.

section_heading: Figure 2. UPR-regulated Transcription Factors may Tailor UPR Activation to Specific Stress Combinations
evidence_span: Several plant-specific transcription factors are upregulated under ER stress in an IRE1/ bZIP28 dependent way.

section_heading: Figure 2. UPR-regulated Transcription Factors may Tailor UPR Activation to Specific Stress Combinations
evidence_span: Two membrane-bound transcription factors, ANAC062 and ANAC089, have been shown to relocate to the nucleus under ER stress.

section_heading: Figure 2. UPR-regulated Transcription Factors may Tailor UPR Activation to Specific Stress Combinations
evidence_span: ANAC062 also is nuclear localized under cold stress conditions.

section_heading: Figure 2. UPR-regulated Transcription Factors may Tailor UPR Activation to Specific Stress Combinations
evidence_span: ANAC089 along with interactor PAS1 (PASTICCINO1) were also shown to relocate to the nucleus in roots treated with 1naphthaleneacetic acid to induce dedifferentiation.
